p: Total flavonoid content was determined according to the methodology defined by Georgé et al. [ 33]. Briefly, 31 μL of standard extracts were taken and placed in a well of a microplate. Then, 125 μL of distilled water and 9.3 μL of 5% NaNO 2 ( w/ v) were added allowed to stand for 5 min. Thereafter, 9.3 μL of Al 2Cl 3 at 10% ( w/ v) was added. Then, the mixture was allowed to stand for 3 min and 125 μL of 0.5 M NaOH was added. Then, the mixture was incubated for 30 min in the absence of light and the absorbance was measured at 510 nm in a BioRad xMark Plus (Hercules, CA, USA), and the data were obtained with the Microplate Manager 6.0 (Tokyo, Japan) computer software. For quantification of the total flavonoid content, a calibration curve was performed using catechin as a standard and results were expressed as mg catechin equivalents by 100 g of dry weight (mg CE/100 g DW). All determinations were made in triplicate.
